page.title: 17FARMING IN CALLINGTON AREA
page.content: Activities differ from farm to farm of {small to medium acreage,}including sheep, dairy and beef, potatoes and horticulture, singly or in various combinations. Root crops, hay and barley are grown, the barley straw being saved for bedding. Silage is produced for stock feeding,some farmers have the expensive round-baling equipment. Farms are mostly run on a{family basis}with casual seasonal employment and school leavers under the Youth Training Scheme. At Rising Sun a family concern of long standing runs a market garden mainly under glass.
